page.title: 20MIDDLETON MEMORIES
page.content:
As we look back sixty years we realise that life is not so hard today as in the 1920s and 30s. While the children and men were at school or work, women spent their time doing housework and making meals. Women didn't go to work because if they were married they were expected to look after the house. Today much of the hard work is done by electricity.
